headline: O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY) Surpasses Q2 Earnings Estimates
summary: O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +1.30% and -0.16%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

raw.headline: O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY) Surpasses Q2 Earnings Estimates

headline: O’Reilly automotive shares slip as full-year guidance disappoints
summary: Investing.com -- O’Reilly Automotive Inc (NASDAQ:ORLY) reported record earnings for the second quarter of 2025, but issued revenue guidance that came in slightly below Wall Street expectations, prompting a modest 0.9% postmarket dip in shares. Despite delivering double-digit earnings growth and robust comps, investor sentiment clipped gains on cautious full-year outlooks.

raw.headline: O’Reilly automotive shares slip as full-year guidance disappoints

headline: O'Reilly (NASDAQ:ORLY) Posts Q2 Sales In Line With Estimates
summary: Auto parts and accessories retailer O’Reilly Automotive (NASDAQ:ORLY) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 5.9% year on year to $4.53 billion. The company’s outlook for the full year was close to analysts’ estimates with revenue guided to $17.65 billion at the midpoint. Its GAAP profit of $0.78 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: O'Reilly Automotive: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the Springfield, Missouri-based company said it had net income of 78 cents. The results topped Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 77 cents per share.

raw.headline: O'Reilly Automotive: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: On a per-share basis, the Springfield, Missouri-based company said it had net income of 78 cents. The results topped Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 77 cents per share.

headline: O’Reilly Automotive, Inc. Reports Second Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Second quarter comparable store sales growth of 4.1%11% increase in second quarter diluted earnings per share to $0.78$1.51 billion net cash provided by operating activities year-to-date SPRINGFIELD, Mo., July 23, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- O’Reilly Automotive, Inc. (the “Company” or “O’Reilly”) (Nasdaq: ORLY), a leading retailer in the automotive aftermarket industry, today announced record revenue and earnings for its second quarter ended June 30, 2025. 2nd Quarter Financial Results Brad Beckham
